content.description: Identify rhythms. After a question is announced, you will have ten seconds to read the choices. It is important that you read the choices carefully before the example is played. Each example will be played twice, with a brief pause between playings.
content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Three measures of music in treble clef, three-four time. Measure one is quarter note C5, eighth notes G4, D5, dotted eighth C5, sixteenth B4. Measure two is eighth note A4, quarter B4, eighth C5, sixteenths D5, E5, F5, E5. Measure three is dotted quarter D5, eighth G4, quarter G4.

Three measures of music in treble clef, three-four time. Measure one is quarter C5, eighth notes G4, D5, dotted eighth C5, sixteenth B4. Measure two is eighth notes A4, B4, C5, D5, E5, sixteenth notes F5, E5. Measure three is dotted quarter D5, eighth G4, quarter G4. .

Three measures of music in treble clef, three-four time. Measure one is quarter C5, eighth notes G4, D5, C5, B4. Measure two is quarter A4, eighth notes B4, C5, sixteenth notes D5, E5, F5, E5. Measure three is dotted eighth D5, sixteenth G4, half note G4.

Three measures of music in treble clef, three-four time. Measure one is quarter C5, eighth notes G4, D5, C5, B4. Measure two is dotted eighth A4, sixteenth notes B4, C5, D5, eighth notes E5, F5, E5. Measure three is dotted eighth D5, sixteenth G4, half note G4.

content.answer: Three measures of music in treble clef, three-four time. Measure one is quarter C5, eighth notes G4, D5, C5, B4. Measure two is quarter A4, eighth notes B4, C5, sixteenth notes D5, E5, F5, E5. Measure three is dotted eighth D5, sixteenth G4, half note G4.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
